intro: Secale cereale subsp. afghanicum, commonly known as Afghan rye, is a subspecies of rye that is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including Afghanistan. It is a perennial grass with slender, tufted stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces颖果 (glumes) that are typically dark brown to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is adapted to well-drained soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects and as a forage crop.
